text: Interaction of HTLV-I <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with the human proteasome : implications for NF-kappa B induction .

The human T-cell leukemia virus type I ( HTLV-I ) has been etiologically associated with the development of the adult T-cell leukemia ( ATL ) as well as degenerative neurologic syndrome termed tropical spastic paraparesis ( TSP ) .
HTLV-I encodes a potent transactivator protein termed <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that appears to play an important role in the process of T-cell immortalization .

Even though the mechanisms by which <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces transformation are still unknown , it seems likely that the ability of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to alter the expression of many cellular genes plays an important part in this process .
<extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> does not bind directly to DNA but rather deregulates the activity of cellular transcription factors .
One family of host transcription factors whose activity is altered by <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> includes NF-kappa B / Rel .

These transcription factors are post - transcriptionally regulated by their assembly with a second family of inhibitory proteins termed I kappa B that serve to sequester the NF-kappa B / Rel complexes in the cytoplasm .
Upon cellular activation , <extra_id_0> I kappa B alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is phosphorylated , polyubiquitinated , and degraded in the proteasome .

text: This proteolytic event liberates NF-kappa B , permitting its rapid translocation into the nucleus where it binds to its cognate enhancer elements .

Similarly , the <extra_id_0> p105 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> precursor of the NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit is also post-translationally processed in the proteasome .
The mechanisms by which <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activates NF-kappa B remain unclear , and findings presented in the literature are often controversial .
We identified a physical interaction between <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the <extra_id_0> HsN3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit of the human proteasome .

text: This raises the intriguing possibility that physical association of the <extra_id_0> HsN3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteasome subunit with HTLV-I <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> coupled with the independent interaction of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with either <extra_id_0> p100 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> I kappa B alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> targets these cytoplasmic NF-kappa B / Rel complexes to the proteasome for processing .
